column4: whats the unzip command is there another program besides unzip to extract a file besides unzip
] is there a command besides unzip or a zip file ....
plenty of them, what are you trying to unpack
or find them in synaptic for installation
and since I finally really read the subtext, look for asterisk in synaptic, you can get it from the repos (highly preferred)
what directory do you have the sources in. Did you have to use sudo to unpack the tar?
move the working directory to your home directory, and chown it to yourself. Easier to work that way
the install location won't change, it's defined in the makefile
a few more nouns, fewer pronouns, please
and any particular reason you're not using asterisk from the repos?
glad to hear you gave up on the vmware appliance ;)
you can't do the apt-get thing with synaptic open, only one package manager at a time
if you're trying to write a config file outside of your home, you need to use sudo privileges. gksudo gedit in a terminal
